message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.OS, cs.AR, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a novel set of policies for distributed storage systems to recover from bit corruption errors in flash devices, which are becoming the main storage medium in datacenters for hot data. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) or Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the implementation of the proposed policies on two real-world storage systems, which suggests that it could also belong to the Databases (cs.DB), Operating Systems (cs.OS), or Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions the use of latent redundancy to recover from bit corruption errors, which suggests that it could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AR) sub-category. Based on these factors, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.OS, cs.AR, and cs.SY, in that order.
